alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 10:56AM CST until February 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Traverse and Big Stone Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1.
